content:
DataGridViewHeaderCell Class

In this Article

Contains functionality common to row header cells and column header cells.

Syntax

Declaration

public class DataGridViewHeaderCell : System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DataGridViewElement
  • System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell
  • DataGridViewHeaderCell

State

Remarks

This class is a base class for other header cell classes, such as DataGridViewRowHeaderCell and DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell. To create custom row header icons or column header glyphs, inherit from the DataGridViewHeaderCell class and add functionality to paint your own icon or glyph.

Constructors summary

DataGridViewHeaderCell()

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewHeaderCell class.

Properties summary

ButtonState

Gets the buttonlike visual state of the header cell.
Displayed

Gets a value that indicates whether the cell is currently displayed on-screen.
FormattedValueType

Gets the type of the formatted value of the cell.
Frozen

Gets a value indicating whether the cell is frozen.
ReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the header cell is read-only.
Resizable

Gets a value indicating whether the cell is resizable.
Selected

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cell is selected.
ValueType

Gets the type of the value stored in the cell.
Visible

Gets a value indicating whether or not the cell is visible.

Creates an exact copy of this cell.

Releases the unmanaged resources used by the DataGridViewHeaderCell and optionally releases the managed resources.

Gets the shortcut menu of the header cell.

Returns a value indicating the current state of the cell as inherited from the state of its row or column.

Gets the size of the cell.
GetValue(Int32)

Gets the value of the cell.
MouseDownUnsharesRow(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell in the row.
MouseEnterUnsharesRow(Int32)

Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer moves over a cell in the row.
MouseLeaveUnsharesRow(Int32)

Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer leaves the row.
MouseUpUnsharesRow(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is released while the pointer is on a cell in the row.
OnMouseDown(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Called when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell.

Called when the mouse pointer enters the cell.
OnMouseLeave(Int32)

Called when the mouse pointer leaves the cell.
OnMouseUp(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Called when the mouse button is released while the pointer is over the cell.

Constructors

  • DataGridViewHeaderCell()

    Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewHeaderCell class.

    public DataGridViewHeaderCell ();

Properties

  • ButtonState

    Gets the buttonlike visual state of the header cell.

    protected System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState ButtonState { get; }

    Property Value

    • ButtonState

      One of the ButtonState values; the default is ButtonState.

    Remarks

    A DataGridViewHeaderCell is like a button in that it can be clicked to set states, such as sorting or performing row-level selection. The ButtonState property uses System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState values to provide buttonlike visual states.

  • Displayed

    Gets a value that indicates whether the cell is currently displayed on-screen.

    public override bool Displayed { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the cell is on-screen or partially on-screen; otherwise, false.

  • FormattedValueType

    Gets the type of the formatted value of the cell.

    public override Type FormattedValueType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      A Type object representing the String type.

    Remarks

    The Value property is the actual data object contained by the cell, whereas the FormattedValue property is the formatted representation of the data. The ValueType and FormattedValueType properties correspond to the data types of these values, respectively.

  • Frozen

    Gets a value indicating whether the cell is frozen.

    public override bool Frozen { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the cell is frozen; otherwise, false. The default is false if the cell is detached from a DataGridView.

    Remarks

    The Frozen property is true if the cell belongs to a frozen row or column, or if the cell is the top-left header cell. A cell, row, or column is frozen when its State property has a value of System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates

  • ReadOnly

    Gets a value indicating whether the header cell is read-only.

    public override bool ReadOnly { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true in all cases.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      An operation tries to set this property.

  • Resizable

    Gets a value indicating whether the cell is resizable.

    public override bool Resizable { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this cell can be resized; otherwise, false. The default is false if the cell is not attached to a DataGridView.

    Remarks

    A row header cell is resizable if the row is resizable or the RowHeadersWidthSizeMode property is set to DataGridViewRowHeadersWidthSizeMode. A column header cell is resizable if the column is resizable or the ColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode property is set to DataGridViewColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode.

  • Selected

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cell is selected.

    public override bool Selected { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      false in all cases.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      This property is being set.

    Remarks

    This property is not meaningful for header cells.

  • ValueType

    Gets the type of the value stored in the cell.

    public override Type ValueType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      A Type object representing the String type.

  • Visible

    Gets a value indicating whether or not the cell is visible.

    public override bool Visible { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the cell is visible; otherwise, false. The default is false if the cell is detached from a DataGridView

    Remarks

    If the cell is a row header cell, then it is visible if its row is visible and the RowHeadersVisible property is true. If the cell is a column header cell, then it is visible if its column is visible and the ColumnHeadersVisible property is true. If the cell is the top left header cell, it is visible if both RowHeadersVisible and ColumnHeadersVisible are true.

Methods

  • Clone()

    Creates an exact copy of this cell.

    public override object Clone ();

    Returns

    • Object

      An Object that represents the cloned DataGridViewHeaderCell.

    Remarks

    Override the Clone method whenever you derive from DataGridViewHeaderCell and add new properties to the derived class.

  • Dispose(Boolean)

    Releases the unmanaged resources used by the DataGridViewHeaderCell and optionally releases the managed resources.

    protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

  • GetInheritedContextMenuStrip(Int32)

    Gets the shortcut menu of the header cell.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip GetInheritedContextMenuStrip (int rowIndex);

    Parameters

    • rowIndex
      Int32

      Ignored by this implementation.

    Returns

    • ContextMenuStrip

      A ContextMenuStrip if the DataGridViewHeaderCell or DataGridView has a shortcut menu assigned; otherwise, null.

    Remarks

    If the DataGridViewHeaderCell does not have a shortcut menu, the DataGridViewHeaderCell will inherit the shortcut menu from the DataGridView. If the DataGridView also does not have a shortcut menu, then the GetInheritedContextMenuStrip method will return null.

  • GetInheritedState(Int32)

    Returns a value indicating the current state of the cell as inherited from the state of its row or column.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates GetInheritedState (int rowIndex);

    Parameters

    • rowIndex
      Int32

      The index of the row containing the cell or -1 if the cell is not a row header cell or is not contained within a DataGridView control.

    Returns

    • DataGridViewElementStates

      A bitwise combination of DataGridViewElementStates values representing the current state of the cell.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The cell is a row header cell, the cell is not contained within a DataGridView control, and rowIndex is not -1.

      - or -

      The cell is a row header cell, the cell is contained within a DataGridView control, and rowIndex is outside the valid range of 0 to the number of rows in the control minus 1.

      - or -

      The cell is a row header cell and rowIndex is not the index of the row containing this cell.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The cell is a column header cell or the control's stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.TopLeftHeaderCell* and rowIndex is not -1.

  • GetSize(Int32)

    Gets the size of the cell.

    protected override System.Drawing.Size GetSize (int rowIndex);

    Parameters

    • rowIndex
      Int32

      The row index of the header cell.

    Returns

    • Size

      A Size that represents the size of the header cell.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElement.DataGridView* property for this cell is null and rowIndex does not equal -1.

      -or-

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningColumn* property for this cell is not null and rowIndex does not equal -1.

      -or-

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningRow* property for this cell is not null and rowIndex is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of rows in the control.

      -or-

      The values of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningColumn* and stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningRow* properties of this cell are both null and rowIndex does not equal -1.

    • ArgumentException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningRow* property for this cell is not null and rowIndex indicates a row other than the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningRow*.

    Remarks

    The GetSize method returns the size necessary to fit in a row of column headers if the header cell is a column header, the size necessary to fit in a column of row headers if the header cell is a row header, or the size necessary to be a DataGridViewTopLeftHeaderCell if the cell is a top left header cell.

    If the cell is not attached to a DataGridView, the Size property of the DataGridViewHeaderCell returns the value (-1,-1).

  • GetValue(Int32)

    Gets the value of the cell.

    protected override object GetValue (int rowIndex);

    Parameters

    • rowIndex
      Int32

      The index of the cell's parent row.

    Returns

    • Object

      The value of the current DataGridViewCell.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      rowIndex is not -1.

  • MouseDownUnsharesRow(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

    Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell in the row.

    protected override bool MouseDownUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs

      A DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs that contains information about the mouse position.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the user clicks with the left mouse button, visual styles are enabled, and the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles* property is true; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    For information about enabling visual styles, see the EnableVisualStyles method.

    MouseDownUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseDown. It must return true if the call to OnMouseDown has the effect of unsharing the row rowIndex. It should return false otherwise.

    For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

  • MouseEnterUnsharesRow(Int32)

    Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer moves over a cell in the row.

    protected override bool MouseEnterUnsharesRow (int rowIndex);

    Parameters

    • rowIndex
      Int32

      The index of the row that the mouse pointer entered.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if visual styles are enabled, and the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles* property is true; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    For information about enabling visual styles, see the EnableVisualStyles method.

    MouseEnterUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseEnter. It must return true if the call to OnMouseEnter has the effect of unsharing the row rowIndex. It should return false otherwise.

    For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

  • MouseLeaveUnsharesRow(Int32)

    Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer leaves the row.

    protected override bool MouseLeaveUnsharesRow (int rowIndex);

    Parameters

    • rowIndex
      Int32

      The index of the row that the mouse pointer left.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState* property value is not ButtonState, visual styles are enabled, and the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles* property is true; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    For information about enabling visual styles, see the EnableVisualStyles method.

    MouseLeaveUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseLeave. It must return true if the call to OnMouseLeave has the effect of unsharing the row rowIndex. It should return false otherwise.

    For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

  • MouseUpUnsharesRow(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

    Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is released while the pointer is on a cell in the row.

    protected override bool MouseUpUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs

      A DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs that contains information about the mouse position.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the left mouse button was released, visual styles are enabled, and the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles* property is true; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    For information about enabling visual styles, see the EnableVisualStyles method.

    MouseUpUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseUp. It must return true if the call to OnMouseUp has the effect of unsharing the row rowIndex. It should return false otherwise.

    For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

  • OnMouseDown(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

    Called when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell.

    protected override void OnMouseDown (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs

      A DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs that contains information about the mouse position.

    Remarks

    The OnMouseDown method sets the ButtonState to ButtonState if the cell is clicked with the left mouse button and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the EnableHeadersVisualStyles property.

    This method is similar to the OnCellMouseDown method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseDown event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

  • OnMouseEnter(Int32)

    Called when the mouse pointer enters the cell.

    protected override void OnMouseEnter (int rowIndex);

    Parameters

    • rowIndex
      Int32

      The index of the row containing the cell.

    Remarks

    The OnMouseEnter method sets the ButtonState to ButtonState if the left mouse button is pressed when the pointer enters the cell and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the EnableHeadersVisualStyles property.

    This method is similar to the OnCellMouseEnter method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseEnter event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

  • OnMouseLeave(Int32)

    Called when the mouse pointer leaves the cell.

    protected override void OnMouseLeave (int rowIndex);

    Parameters

    • rowIndex
      Int32

      The index of the row containing the cell.

    Remarks

    The OnMouseLeave method sets the ButtonState to ButtonState if it was in another state and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the EnableHeadersVisualStyles property.

    This method is similar to the OnCellMouseLeave method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseLeave event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

  • OnMouseUp(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

    Called when the mouse button is released while the pointer is over the cell.

    protected override void OnMouseUp (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs

      A DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs that contains information about the mouse position.

    Remarks

    The OnMouseUp method sets the ButtonState to ButtonState if the left mouse button was released and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the EnableHeadersVisualStyles property.

    This method is similar to the OnCellMouseUp method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseUp event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

  • Paint(Graphics,Rectangle,Rectangle,Int32,DataGridViewElementStates,Object,Object,String,DataGridViewCellStyle,DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle,DataGridViewPaintParts)

    Paints the current DataGridViewHeaderCell.

    protected override void Paint (System.Drawing.Graphics graphics, System.Drawing.Rectangle clipBounds, System.Drawing.Rectangle cellBounds, int rowIndex, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates dataGridViewElementState, object value, object formattedValue, string errorText, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle cellStyle, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle advancedBorderStyle, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewPaintParts paintParts);

    Parameters

    • graphics
      Graphics

      The Graphics used to paint the cell.

    • clipBounds
      Rectangle

      A Rectangle that represents the area of the DataGridView that needs to be repainted.

    • cellBounds
      Rectangle

      A Rectangle that contains the bounds of the cell that is being painted.

    • rowIndex
      Int32

      The row index of the cell that is being painted.

    • dataGridViewElementState
      DataGridViewElementStates

      A bitwise combination of DataGridViewElementStates values that specifies the state of the cell.

    • value
      Object

      The data of the cell that is being painted.

    • formattedValue
      Object

      The formatted data of the cell that is being painted.

    • errorText
      String

      An error message that is associated with the cell.

    • cellStyle
      DataGridViewCellStyle

      A DataGridViewCellStyle that contains formatting and style information about the cell.

    • advancedBorderStyle
      DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle

      A DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle that contains border styles for the cell that is being painted.

    • paintParts
      DataGridViewPaintParts

      A bitwise combination of the DataGridViewPaintParts values that specifies which parts of the cell need to be painted.

  • ToString()

    Returns a string that describes the current object.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A string that represents the current object.
